content:
I'm still having the bug where inactive, pinned streams stay inactive even after messages come in. In this case a hard refresh fixed it.

We've discussed removing the concept of inactive, pinned streams, so that streams are either: pinned, normal active, normal muted, or inactive from a visual UI perspective. What do folks think of that change?
I wish we'd do away with the "inactive" concept altogether. I think it would feel funny for pinned streams not to stay pinned.
I find the "inactive" feature invaluable, and I've heard a number of users in other large realms say it's one of their favorite parts of Zulip

I think what @Rishi Gupta was proposing is that we don't do the inactive-fading for pinned streams?

I agree it doesn't make sense from a UI perspective for pinned streams to fall to the bottom.

yeah, my proposal is just to not fade inactive, pinned streams. But we should fix the bug regardless.

What is the intended behavior if:

  • There is an inactive, pinned stream
  • You click on it and click on a topic, to load some messages

Should the stream stay faded, or not?
Labelling the lists of streams will go a long way towards making them more understandable
